title: How to Make Traditional Middle Eastern Hummus

steps.headline: Open your cans of chick peas, strain, and wash. After washing let drip for a few minutes and add to the food processor.
Cut and peel your four cloves of garlic.
steps.description: Cut them in half and add them to the food processor. [Image:Cutgarlic.jpg|center|180px]]

steps.headline: Measure 5 tablespoons of tahini (ground sesame seed) and add to the food processor.
Measure and add 1 teaspoon of salt to the food processor.
Measure and add 2/3 cup of lemon juice to the food processor.
Measure and add 3 tablespoons of plain greek yogurt to the food processor.
Add only 1/4 cup of olive oil to the food processor.
steps.description: You will use the rest in following steps. Before using processor,  consult with the manufacturers instructions to ensure safety!

steps.headline: Begin processing all of the ingredients for 2 minutes.
steps.description: While processing, stream in remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil.

steps.headline: After 2 minutes scrape walls of processor to ensure all ingredients are blended.
steps.description: If not blended to a desired texture. Blend for an additional minute until satisfied.

steps.headline: If desired, you can drizzle a little olive oil on top and garnish with 1/2 teaspoon of paprika.

text: Open your cans of chick peas, strain, and wash. After washing let drip for a few minutes and add to the food processor.  Cut and peel your four cloves of garlic. Cut them in half and add them to the food processor. [Image:Cutgarlic.jpg|center|180px]] Measure 5 tablespoons of tahini (ground sesame seed) and add to the food processor.  Measure and add 1 teaspoon of salt to the food processor.  Measure and add 2/3 cup of lemon juice to the food processor.  Measure and add 3 tablespoons of plain greek yogurt to the food processor.  Add only 1/4 cup of olive oil to the food processor. You will use the rest in following steps. Before using processor,  consult with the manufacturers instructions to ensure safety! Begin processing all of the ingredients for 2 minutes. While processing, stream in remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil. After 2 minutes scrape walls of processor to ensure all ingredients are blended. If not blended to a desired texture. Blend for an additional minute until satisfied. If desired, you can drizzle a little olive oil on top and garnish with 1/2 teaspoon of paprika.  Finished.
